SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To report 7 cases of acquired hemoglobin H in myelodysplastic syndromes
CASE DATA AND DISCUSSION: Clinical materials of the 7 cases were retrospectively presented
Clinical features of the similar cases in literatures were reviewed
The criteria for diagnosis of this entity by Steensma and its pathogenesis were discussed
CONCLUSION: This entity is a new subtype of MDS with unique clinical features and pathogenesis, and might be a proper model in the study of MDS transformation
